WRITING.TITLE: Netflix is Taking an Interest in Live Action Adaptations of Anime, Could Berserk Be Next?

Its concievable to think that Netflix might be interested in pursuing some type of live action version of Berserk, whether it be a series or a film. What do you all think? No you have it backwards, if you lose an appeal, then you file a counter notification to the DCMA complaint. Unless the copyright holder files a lawsuit against you, your video will be restored as well as your channel if it was suspended. Its not you who has to file the suit, its the copyright holder. But, you better be damned sure that you comply with the four prong test, because if your not and they do decide to sue, you now can be found liable for copyright infringement ontop of anything youtube might do to you.

WRITING.TEXT: Its not my thinking, its federal case law. If you are using literally 1 second of footage in the manner i described above, and issue a counter-notification to a takedown notice, any smart corporate attorney would stop there and take no further action. There is a four prong test to determining fair use: Purpose and Character of Use, Nature of the Copyrighted Work, Amount and Substantiality, and Effect Upon Work's Value. So long as the original source from which the 1 second of footage is at least a couple minutes long, such use as i previously described is literally the very core of the fair use doctrine. Note that we are talking about video footage here, case law has practically eliminated or severly restricted most utilizations of the fair use doctrine for music recordings outside of parody.
"Be dangerous" lol
[I'm waiting so long... I'm waiting so long... I'm waiting so long... I'm waiting...](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=70GD2SBCq64)
Here you go, [Rickert has one for you](http://imgur.com/ZCQUkg2)

No, if someone literally used one second of copyrighted footage, and then spent five minutes providing technical analysis of what occured in that one second of footage, it would mostl likely fall under fair use. Thats literally why fair use exists. Extremely small pieces of copyrighted footage can be used under fair use, so long as its for criticism, news reporting, teaching, or research. Longer pieces of copyrighted footage can generally only fall under fair use if its for the purpose of parody.

WRITING.TEXT: I would wager that they did in fact contact Marc Diraison, but that his availability was such that there would have been a delay in production. The distributors probably wanted fast cash flow out of what they no doubt have already paid liscensing fees for, and thus pushed to have the project completed no later than the debut of season two of the new Berserk anime so as to ride the wave of that seasons release. If that is the real way it went down, i can understand the thinking behind that, but i still think it was a major mistake in the long run because it turns longtime fans away from product and discourages them from recommending it to people who havent necessarily been exposed to Berserk before.

Given that the Uhna works to at least some degree, the North Koreans should be able to throw at least a crude version of it adapted as an icbm if they so desired. The basic problem they still have i imagine is creating a delivery vehicle that can survive re-entry.

North Korea recently tested a high thrust engine and has stated that it is in the final stages of developing an intercontinental ballistic missile. Experts believe that given the recent flurry of missile tests that a test of a North Korean ICBM that could possibly hit the United States mailand is likely to occur soon. This is alarming considering the increasing tensions between North Korean and the United States, and the current American government's statement that it would not allow North Korea to develop such a weapon.
